access_level_remote_id.description: The machine-readable identifier of the access level.

access_level.description:
# Access Level Object
### Description
The `AccessLevel` object is used to represent the level of access that a principal has. The "default" access
level is a `AccessLevel` object whose fields are all empty strings.

### Usage Example
View the `AccessLevel` of a resource/user or resource/group pair to see the level of access granted to the resource.

group_id.description: The ID of the group.
The ID of the group to apply the tag to. Requires replacement if changed.

tag_id.description: The ID of the tag to apply. Requires replacement if changed.

access_level_name.description: The human-readable name of the access level.

access_level_remote_id.description: The machine-readable identifier of the access level.

access_level.description:
# Access Level Object
### Description
The `GroupAccessLevel` object is used to represent the level of access that a user has to a group or a group has to a group. The "default" access
level is a `GroupAccessLevel` object whose fields are all empty strings.

### Usage Example
View the `GroupAccessLevel` of a group/user or group/group pair to see the level of access granted to the group.

access_level_remote_id.description: The remote ID of the access level to grant to this user. If omitted, the default access level remote ID value (empty string) is used. Requires replacement if changed.

duration_minutes.description: Must be set to 0. Any nonzerovalue in terraform does not make sense. Default: 0; must be "0"; Requires replacement if changed.

expiration_date.description: The day and time the user's access will expire.

group_id.description: The ID of the group. Requires replacement if changed.

status.description: The status of whether the user has been synced to the group or resource in the remote system. must be one of ["SUCCESS", "ERR_REMOTE_INTERNAL_ERROR", "ERR_REMOTE_USER_NOT_FOUND", "ERR_REMOTE_USER_NOT_LINKED", "ERR_REMOTE_RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND", "ERR_REMOTE_THROTTLE", "ERR_NOT_AUTHORIZED_TO_QUERY_RESOURCE", "ERR_REMOTE_PROVISIONING_VIA_IDP_FAILED", "ERR_IDP_EMAIL_UPDATE_CONFLICT", "ERR_TIMEOUT", "ERR_UNKNOWN", "ERR_OPAL_INTERNAL_ERROR", "ERR_ORG_READ_ONLY", "ERR_OPERATION_UNSUPPORTED", "PENDING", "PENDING_MANUAL_PROPAGATION", "PENDING_TICKET_CREATION", "ERR_TICKET_CREATION_SKIPPED", "ERR_DRY_RUN_MODE_ENABLED", "ERR_HR_IDP_PROVIDER_NOT_LINKED", "ERR_REMOTE_UNRECOVERABLE_ERROR"]

propagation_status.description: The state of whether the push action was propagated to the remote system. If this is null, the access was synced from the remote system.

access_level.description:
# Access Level Object
### Description
The `AccessLevel` object is used to represent the level of access that a principal has. The "default" access
level is a `AccessLevel` object whose fields are all empty strings.

### Usage Example
View the `AccessLevel` of a resource/user or resource/group pair to see the level of access granted to the resource.

group_id.description: The ID of the group.

operator.description: The operator of the reviewer stage. Admin and manager approval are also treated as reviewers.

require_admin_approval.description: Whether this reviewer stage should require admin approval.

require_manager_approval.description: Whether this reviewer stage should require manager approval.

data.description: The reviewer stages for this group.

group_id.description: The ID of the group.
The ID of the group whose tags to return.

updated_at.description: The date the tag was last updated.

user_creator_id.description: The ID of the user that created the tag.

group_id.description: The ID of the group.

access_level_name.description: The human-readable name of the access level.

access_level_remote_id.description: The machine-readable identifier of the access level.

access_level.description:
# Access Level Object
### Description
The `GroupAccessLevel` object is used to represent the level of access that a user has to a group or a group has to a group. The "default" access
level is a `GroupAccessLevel` object whose fields are all empty strings.

### Usage Example
View the `GroupAccessLevel` of a group/user or group/group pair to see the level of access granted to the group.

expiration_date.description: The day and time the user's access will expire.

group_id.description: The ID of the group.

status.description: The status of whether the user has been synced to the group or resource in the remote system.

propagation_status.description: The state of whether the push action was propagated to the remote system. If this is null, the access was synced from the remote system.

### Description
The `RequestStatus` enum is used to represent the status of a request.

access_level.description:
# Access Level Object
### Description
The `AccessLevel` object is used to represent the level of access that a principal has. The "default" access
level is a `AccessLevel` object whose fields are all empty strings.

### Usage Example
View the `AccessLevel` of a resource/user or resource/group pair to see the level of access granted to the resource.

expiration_date.description: The day and time the user's access will expire.

has_direct_access.description: The user has direct access to this resources (vs. indirectly, like through a group).

num_access_paths.description: The number of ways in which the user has access through this resource (directly and indirectly).

status.description: The status of whether the user has been synced to the group or resource in the remote system.

propagation_status.description: The state of whether the push action was propagated to the remote system. If this is null, the access was synced from the remote system.

next.description: The cursor with which to continue pagination if additional result pages exist.

previous.description: The cursor used to obtain the current result page.

access_level_name.description: The human-readable name of the access level.

access_level_remote_id.description: The machine-readable identifier of the access level.

access_level.description:
# Access Level Object
### Description
The `AccessLevel` object is used to represent the level of access that a principal has. The "default" access
level is a `AccessLevel` object whose fields are all empty strings.

### Usage Example
View the `AccessLevel` of a resource/user or resource/group pair to see the level of access granted to the resource.

expiration_date.description: The day and time the user's access will expire.

user_id.description: The ID of the user you wish to query sessions for.

created_at.description: The date the tag was created.

updated_at.description: The date the tag was last updated.

user_creator_id.description: The ID of the user that created the tag.

next.description: The cursor with which to continue pagination if additional result pages exist.

page_size.description: Number of results to return per page. Default is 200.

previous.description: The cursor used to obtain the current result page.

created_at.description: The date the tag was created.

updated_at.description: The date the tag was last updated.

user_creator_id.description: The ID of the user that created the tag.

deadline.description: The last day for reviewers to complete their access reviews.

name.description: The name of the UAR.

reviewer_assignment_policy.description: A policy for auto-assigning reviewers. If auto-assignment is on, specific assignments can still be manually adjusted after the access review is started. Default is Manually.

self_review_allowed.description: A bool representing whether to present a warning when a user is the only reviewer for themself. Default is False.

send_reviewer_assignment_notification.description: A bool representing whether to send a notification to reviewers when they're assigned a new review. Default is False.

time_zone.description: The time zone name (as defined by the IANA Time Zone database) used in the access review deadline and exported audit report. Default is America/Los_Angeles.

admins.description: This access review will include resources and groups who are owned by one of the owners corresponding to the given IDs.

apps.description: This access review will include items in the specified applications

entities.description: This access review will include resources and groups with ids in the given strings.

filter_operator.description: Specifies whether entities must match all (AND) or any (OR) of the filters.

group_types.description: This access review will include items of the specified group types

group_visibility.description: Specifies what users can see during an Access Review

names.description: This access review will include resources and groups whose name contains one of the given strings.

resource_types.description: This access review will include items of the specified resource types

tags.description: This access review will include resources and groups who are tagged with one of the given tags.

users.description: The access review will only include the following users. If any users are selected, any entity filters will be applied to only the entities that the selected users have access to.

uar_scope.description: If set, the access review will only contain resources and groups that match at least one of the filters in scope.

next.description: The cursor with which to continue pagination if additional result pages exist.

page_size.description: Number of results to return per page. Default is 200.

previous.description: The cursor used to obtain the current result page.

self_review_allowed.description: A bool representing whether to present a warning when a user is the only reviewer for themself. Default is False.

send_reviewer_assignment_notification.description: A bool representing whether to send a notification to reviewers when they're assigned a new review. Default is False.

time_zone.description: The time zone name (as defined by the IANA Time Zone database) used in the access review deadline and exported audit report. Default is America/Los_Angeles.

admins.description: This access review will include resources and groups who are owned by one of the owners corresponding to the given IDs.

apps.description: This access review will include items in the specified applications

entities.description: This access review will include resources and groups with ids in the given strings.

filter_operator.description: Specifies whether entities must match all (AND) or any (OR) of the filters.

group_types.description: This access review will include items of the specified group types

group_visibility.description: Specifies what users can see during an Access Review

names.description: This access review will include resources and groups whose name contains one of the given strings.

resource_types.description: This access review will include items of the specified resource types

tags.description: This access review will include resources and groups who are tagged with one of the given tags.

users.description: The access review will only include the following users. If any users are selected, any entity filters will be applied to only the entities that the selected users have access to.

uar_scope.description: If set, the access review will only contain resources and groups that match at least one of the filters in scope.

email.description: The email of the user. If both user ID and email are provided, user ID will take precedence. If neither are provided, an error will occur.

first_name.description: The first name of the user.
